title: Florida man is charged with manslaughter for beating a peeping Tom to death
text:
Victor Vickery, 30, was arrested Thursday and charged with manslaughter in the July 2, 2018 death of Asaad Akar, 57

A Florida man has been charged for beating a peeping Tom to death.

Victor Vickery, 30, was arrested Thursday and charged with manslaughter in the July 2, 2018 death of Asaad Akar, 57.

According to Fort Lauderdale police, Akar was partially naked and peeping through the window while Vickery and his girlfriend were having sex.

A fight broke out when Vickery confronted Akar, resulting in Akar's death.

More than a year later, Vickery has been arrested and charged and is now being held behind bars on a $100,000 bond while he awaits trial.

According to a police report, Vickery and his girlfriend Samantha Hobi were getting intimate in the bedroom of her Fort Lauderdale home when the couple heard a scratching noise coming from outside their window.

Vickery claimed he saw Akar exposed outside of the window when he went outside.

He told police that he had called authorities to report a peeping Tom in the past.

Police say Vickery and his girlfriend were getting intimate in her Fort Lauderdale bedroom when they were scratching from outside their window

When Vickery went to inspect the noise he found Akar partially naked and peeping into the window

Police said Hobi called the cops as the men were fighting and can be heard on the recording of that three-minute call repeatedly saying, 'Tori stop. Tori that's enough.'

Vickery told police that Akar had lunged at him, got on top of him and began choking him.

He also said that he he kicked Akar and punched him 'a handful of times,' according to the report.

When Akar tried to run, Vickery chased him and held him down, he told investigators.

When police arrived Vickery had dried blood on his hands and body and his right foot was bloodied and swollen.

Akar, who lived around the corner from Hobi, was taken to Broward Health North hospital in Deerfield Beach.

He died at the hospital within two hours from blunt force trauma to his head and torso.

Akar had a history of arrests for prowling, Sgt. Steven Novak wrote in his report.

Investigators collected evidence that showed Akar 'had been peeping into windows at several different addresses,' Vickery's arrest report said, according to the Sun Sentinel.
description: Victor Vickery, 30, was arrested Thursday and charged with manslaughter in the July 2, 2018 death of Asaad Akar, 57, in Fort Lauderdale.
